Spring Polling Finds Americans Don’t Support Closing Department of Education

This spring, we surveyed thousands of adults and school parents across the country on issues ranging from mental health to school choice to the role of the federal government in education. Here’s a quick look at what we found.
Read More

The Supply Side of ESAs

The Supply Side of ESAs: How Universal School Choice Programs Have Affected the Number of Private Schools and Home Education Vendors explores how education savings account (ESA) programs and other choice programs are reshaping the K–12 landscape—not just in terms of who can choose, but what families can choose from.
Read More

Hope Returns to the Classroom

How are teachers feeling as the 2025 school year comes to a close? How has student absenteeism changed, if at all, according to teachers? Has classroom behavior improved? 

Explore the 2025 Spring Teacher Survey

By the Numbers

Parent Preferences

Actual Enrollment

EdChoice Blog

  • Short-Term Test Scores Miss the Real Story on School Choice

    Michael McShane argues that an overemphasis on immediate standardized test results overlooks the broader, long-term benefits of school choice, such as improved student engagement, character development, and educational equity.

  • Key Moments from the Oral Arguments in OK Statewide Charter School Board v. Drummond

    Michael McShane breaks down the oral arguments for Oklahoma Statewide Charter School Board v. Drummond which took place before the Supreme Court last month.

  • How Churches Can Lead in School Choice

    Dr. Doug Richey— a former pastor and Missouri state representative—shares practical advice and steps on how churches can lead in school choice.

EdChoice YouTube

Want to know what a voucher is? Want to see some powerful stories of families choosing school choice? We have it all on our YouTube channel!

Visit Our YouTube Page

Podcasts

  • Ep. 2: Sunday School Choice featuring Dr. Doug Richey

    In this episode we talk with Dr. Doug Richey, a former pastor and Missouri state representative, who shares his unique perspective on the intersection of faith, education, and public policy.

  • State of Choice with Trish Donahue of HopSkipDrive

    We talk with Trish Donahue, Senior Vice President of Legal and Policy at HopSkipDrive, about a topic that's critical but often overlooked in school choice conversations: transportation.

  • EdChoice Chats: School Starter Checklist Rankings

    In this edition of EdChoice Chats, John Kristof and Mike McShane talk about the new report School Starter Checklist Rankings and some of the interesting things they found.
